DataElement.preferredName: Companion Blood Culture Specimen Initiation Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Characteristic or indicative of (e.g., a disease)._A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms._Collected; brought together in one place._Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events._the time at which an event was observed or occurred.

It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
Any laboratory procedure for growing microorganisms.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

Concepts.definition: The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the time at which an event was observed or occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
